item.title: Personal: I'm Back
item.description: Well, it’s been a while. I could give a long, winding story about why this site went dark for 18’ish months, but instead I’ll just take the opportunity to inform everyone that I’ve been working at Tesla since March 2021. I love the team I’m on and it’s been a lot of fun. There are also a lot of things they don’t want me talking about so that’s the last I’m going to say on that topic, for the time being.

item.title: Damocles: New Tools
item.description: I just wrapped up reconfiguring Damocles to use Bootstrap and layout-wise I am extremely happy with the result. The Bootstrap integration with React is excellent and intuitive and I look forward to doing more with it. The next step is going to involve getting some more labels put up and otherwise reworking a bunch of fixed strings so it’s not like I’m going to need to wait long. In other news, I decided to treat myself and I went and bought a number of JetBrains tools, including their web development IDE “WebStorm”.

item.title: Damocles: Casing Woes
item.description: I wrapped up a long running refactor of my online board game Damocles today with a deployment to Heroku. I want to focus this post on a pain point I ran into while doing this related to casing. The purpose behind the refactor was to break up a monolithic file containing almost every React based piece of the project into separate files for all the React components. Part of this involved renaming some of the existing files, as I wanted to go from lowercase to PascalCase (ie, damoclesgame to DamoclesGame).

item.title: Personal Site: New Site Pt. 2
item.description: Today I wrapped up some outstanding issues related to the site relating to the DNS and Domain Host. In particular, I transferred the matthewbunge.com domain from GoDaddy, where I had held it for 7 years, to Namecheap. The primary motiviation was financial: the running costs of the website were reduced by approximately 55% annually. In practice, this is like 12 bucks, but saved money for no real cost is still saved money.

item.title: Personal Site: New Site
item.description: My original website is years old at this point and kind of a mess, so I decided to make a new one. This time around I decided to harness the power of a static site generator. After trying a couple out, I decided to go with Hugo. I want my personal site to be more of a personal blog and I think Hugo is extremely adept at handling that use case.
